newsitem.title: UK: Oxford Biomedica launches legal action.
newsitem.headline: Oxford Biomedica launches legal action.

text.p: British biomedical company Oxford Biomedica Plc said on Wednesday it had issued court proceedings against two underwriters who Biomedica said failed to honour obligations in its share offer and placing last year.
Biomedica said it issued proceedings in the High Court of London against Stockton Trading Ltd, a Bahamas-registered company, and Kaj Kjellquist, a private investor from Sweden.
Biomedica's placing and offer for subscription was made in November last year.

Biomedica issued shares at 88p each but the stock slipped over 40 percent on its debut on the Alternative Investment Market (AIM) because the two underwriters were trying to pull out of the issue, Biomedica said in December.
The shares were trading at 50-1/2p on Wednesday, down two pence on the day.
Oxford Biomedica is a fledgling gene therapy company set up by the directors of Oxford University's retrovirus molecular biology group. The firm plans to develop drugs to fight cancer and AIDS.
